    Ordered monoids #

    This file develops the basics of ordered monoids.

    Implementation details #

    Unfortunately, the number of ' appended to lemmas in this file may differ between the multiplicative and the additive version of a lemma. The reason is that we did not want to change existing names in the library.

    Remark #

    Almost no monoid is actually present in this file: most assumptions have been generalized to Mul or MulOneClass.

    source
    instance Nat.instCovariantClassMulLE :
    CovariantClass (fun (x x_1 : ) => x * x_1) fun (x x_1 : ) => x x_1

            def AddLECancellable { : Type u_1} [Add ] [LE ] (a : ) :
            Prop

            An element a : is AddLECancellable if x a + x is order-reflecting. We will make a separate version of many lemmas that require [ContravariantClass (+) ()] with AddLECancellable assumptions instead. These lemmas can then be instantiated to specific types, like ENNReal, where we can replace the assumption AddLECancellable x by x .

            Equations
            • AddLECancellable a = b c : , a + b a + c b c
            Instances For
              source
              def MulLECancellable { : Type u_1} [Mul ] [LE ] (a : ) :
              Prop

              An element a : is MulLECancellable if x a * x is order-reflecting. We will make a separate version of many lemmas that require [ContravariantClass (*) ()] with MulLECancellable assumptions instead. These lemmas can then be instantiated to specific types, like ENNReal, where we can replace the assumption AddLECancellable x by x .

              Equations
              • MulLECancellable a = b c : , a * b a * c b c
